repnme.cdata!:
China - Inner Mongolia Snowstorm Emergency
            Recovery Component Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was highly likely, the institutional development was
            satisfactory, and the Bank and borrower performance were
            both satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that despite
            the time pressure during project preparation and appraisal,
            a lot of attention was paid to design details including
            breakdown of costs and procurement down to county level.
            Even more importantly, the scope of the project was well
            focused, and preparation avoided the inclusion of too many
            or too sophisticated components. In emergency reconstruction
            programs, early availability of funds or authorization,
            together with competent business procedures and record
            keeping are essential to address the disaster repairs in a
            timely manner. Dedicated high-level government management
            and close interaction between Provincial, Prefecture and
            County-level management teams is essential to achieve
            success. In emergency reconstruction programs, Assisting
            individual households in their recovery from an emergency
            situation requires considerable attention to a well
            thought-through targeting of the limited resources. Due to
            its emergency nature the project focuses on reconstruction
            of physical and social infrastructure. However, a crucial
            part of the success towards this aim was the training
            provided under the project. A strong emphasis on input and
            output monitoring, reporting, and supervision has
            contributed to a quality implementation of the project. The
            transfer of this management approaches will serve the
            implementing agencies well in many future activities. The
            lesson is to be careful in including tasks in an emergency
            project that involves continual coordination between line
            agencies. While the other components were under the primary
            responsibility of the Project Management Office (PMO) staff
            located in the Animal Husbandry Bureau (AHB) and the
            Financial Bureau (FB), the rehabilitation of schools and
            clinics required strong involvement of the FB as well as the
            bureaus for education and health on various levels.

China - Inner Mongolia Snowstorm Emergency
            Recovery Component Project

repnme.cdata!:
China - Songliao Plain Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Songliao Plain
            Agricultural Development Project for China was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the borrower performance was satisfactory.
            The lessons learned indicate that for better project
            implementation and results, the Bank should avoid projects
            with too many components and activities financed from one
            project. The woman's participation as a project in the
            Staff Appraisal Report (SAR), facilitated to achieve high
            rates of female involvement in the project. The project
            could have formulated better poverty-targeting selection
            criteria, so that the entire rural population could
            participate in all the activities sponsored under the project.

2143714.trustfund:
TF040974-CHINA: SECOND RED SOILS II (MAR COMPONENT),TF038568-CHINA:  RED SOILS AREA DEVELOPMENT,TF020761-AUSTRALIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST
            FUND (USD)

repnme.cdata!: China - Second Red Soils Area Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, sustainability highly likely, and the
            institutional development impacts substantial. The project
            successfully demonstrated that a comprehensive development
            of small watersheds, integrating crop and livestock, as a
            means to rehabilitate infertile soils, can be widely
            applied, even further refined if needed, on similar,
            under-fertilized red soil areas. Lessons of success, namely
            feature, the development, and application of comprehensive
            technical standards; adequate training of both project staff
            and farmers; selection of capable, and motivated
            beneficiaries; and, a timely availability of counterpart
            funding. Moreover, production diversification was a
            contributing factor, particularly in minimizing risks of
            weather-related crop-damage: diversifying orchard crops with
            deciduous fruits, i.e., plum, pear, and peach, or citrus
            varieties, as well as lychee, longan, and loquat, gave
            positive results, following the careful site selection of
            frost-susceptible crops. The need for diversification is
            reinforced by the volatility of agricultural market prices;
            however, production marketing, particularly of high-value
            fruit output, requires strengthening of market information
            systems, and assistance to growers in setting-up marketing
            groups. While investments in agro-processing enterprises
            (Government owned/operated) has been generally unsuccessful,
            by contrast, private participation - as shown by the project
            - provided the needed influx in management skills, and
            working capital, which lead to profitable enterprises.
